title: Preparing inputs for rsortie
text: base parameter file contains many different formats behaviours variables. behaviours simple variable name value line. include species, grouped complex .xml hierarchy structure. completely uniquely named, many require first identifying location correct behaviour finding appropriate variable name within behaviour. Type column VariableNames data.frame critical identify format variable thus rules code finding replacing right variable. far, eight different formats identified coded: 1 = basic case: variable parameter directly name 2 = basic case species: , species name 3 = behaviorlist type: basic parameter - similar 1 4 = behaviorlist type: species - similar 2 5 = output files: parameter file directory name 6 = groups species previous line, e.g. initial density 7 = disturbance types 8 = behaviourlist type: similar 4, subgroup, unique tag Variable Types: Blue text example base parameter file (SORTIE-generated file). Green text example VariableNames file purple text example parameter value file (csv file). Type 1: value line directly variable name: <timesteps>20</timesteps>Timesteps,1,timesteps,Timesteps,66,66,66,66 Type 2: parameter includes species name, value still line: <tr_mshVal species=“Interior_Spruce”>1.35</tr_mshVal>Max.Seedling.Hgt.m, 2, tr_mshVal species,Max.Seedling.Hgt.m,1.35,1.35,1.35,1.35 Type 3: parameter like type 1, inside BehaviourList. BehaviourList becomes part input parameter file, since specific .xml file used. <nciDbhDivisor>100.0</nciDbhDivisor> NCI.DBH.div,3,nciDbhDivisor, NCIMasterGrowth5,NCI.DBH.div,100,100,100,100 type also inside grid: <ma_plotLenX>100</ma_plotLenX> <ma_plotLenY>200</ma_plotLenY> </grid> plotLenX,3,ma_plotLenX,plotLenY,3,ma_plotLenY, harvestmastercutsplotLenX,100,100,100,100plotLenY,200,200,200,200 Type 4: parameter like type 2, inside BehaviourList. BehaviourList becomes part input parameter value file, since specific .xml file used. Note type 4 must also contain group name VariableName file. (cases, variable use multiple times .xml file need group name figure case .) <gr_nmpgVal species=“Interior_Spruce”>4.0152016</gr_nmpgVal> NCI.MaxGrowth,4,gr_nmpgVal species, gr_nciMaxPotentialGrowth NCIMasterGrowth5,NCI.MaxGrowth,1.65655768851703,2.22957895018928,1.75110747720752,2.37639294490124 Type 5: Output files. code assumes parameter value file contains directory. code writes information xml file, writes directory specified parameter value file unique file name. Currently code set-Output ShortOutput specific file extensions. version code, file types may work, even added VariablesName file. ShortOutput,5,so_filename, ShortOutput,C:\Projects\SORTIE\test\ Type 6: groups species previous line. <tr_initialDensity sizeClass=“s4.0”>25.0</tr_initialDensity> Init.Dens.4,6,tr_initialDensity sizeClass=“s4.0”,tr_idVals Init.Dens.4,0,0,75,0 Type 7: Disturbance types (e.g. Episodic Mortality). like Behaviour types. new values file, disturbance type goes one line variable name values species following line. VariableNames file just requires names type. use type update species-specific parameter values (.e. amount lodgepole pine harvest), opposed replacing harvest layout .xml chunk. amountToCut,7,ds_amountToCut, EpisodicMortality1amountToCut,55,56,57,58 Type 8: value within behaviour list (similar 4), subgroup <gr_nmpgVal species=“Interior_Spruce”>4.0152016</gr_nmpgVal> current version VariableNames file exhaustive. contains variables used testing files. title: rsortie basics
text: SORTIE-ND (hereafter SORTIE) individual-based, spatially-explicit model forest stand dynamics. Specifically: SORTIE simulates processes establishment, growth, mortality individuals, resource-mediated (primarily light) interactions Trees individuals x-y coordinates interact neighbourhoods Complex, spatial, aspatial silviculture experiments, including partial harvests planting, built SORTIE SORTIE tracks trees space time, meaning metric can applied individuals stands, can calculated SORTIE outputs. break key components:

title: rsortie basics
text: SORTIE like “umbrella” model many models (functions) within . models (functions) control processes, establishment, growth, mortality, resource allocation. processes termed “behaviours”. words, behaviour function (parameterized model) describes part processes. describe shape response relationship variables (e.g., logistic growth curve function tree size). Behaviors active part SORTIE simulation. Nothing model pre-defined, default, automatic. Everything happens done behavior, behaviors user control. example, can behaviour calculate light levels, another determine tree growth result amount light, another select trees die grow slowly.

title: rsortie basics
text: tree basic unit data model. model tree collection attributes describing one individual, location, species, size.

title: rsortie basics
text: simulation starts initial tree environment conditions, acted upon behaviours change model state. SORTIE parameter file Opening SORTIE GUI instantly produce usable model. valid SORTIE parameter file required. SORTIE parameter file contains behaviours (functions) define forest establish, grow, die. variables (parameters) contained within selected behaviours must defined make functions work. Theoretically, construct SORTIE parameter file based solely literature-produced parameter values, long functions available SORTIE. often, series years many publications, parameter files built abundance field data used parameterize SORTIE behaviours (functions). initial parameterization, validation, model testing, certain parameter values may require calibration better reflect forest stand dynamics place interest. Calibration processes predictions model compared observations afterwards one parameter values changed produce predictions match observations. initiate SORTIE simulation, must SORTIE parameter file (build one) populate parameter values required behaviours. Please see www.sortie-nd.org detailed model description, including recommended minimum stand sizes definition behaviours contained model. Initial conditions valid SORTIE parameter file, next step initiation define starting conditions one particular forest: run length, plot dimension, starting forest composition. initial stand conditions, SORTIE often initiated tree list: table contains density (stems/ha) tree species user-defined diameter classes. Alternatively, stand can initiated spatial tree map (stem map) exact starting location, identity size (diameter) trees. SORTIE outputs many possible outputs SORTIE simulation. output options must selected initiation applied parameter file, including desired location output file(s). two output files created SORTIE run: detailed summary, different options select either.

title: rsortie basics
text: rsortie designed support continuous workflow data management model outputs, making model development, parameterization, experimentation, validation efficient reproducible (McIntire et al. 2021 preprint). rsortie takes advantage packages already developed R, including ability manipulate datasets spatial files effectively, supporting larger complex experiments applied within SORTIE. Examples uses rsortie explored vignettes. rsortie can used continuous workflow stages. important note development rsortie workflow requires use SORTIE GUI set starting point. Often complex silviculture prescriptions experimental designs, may still stopping points within workflow user needs interact SORTIE GUI well. Creating first SORTIE parameter file define SORTIE run must occur GUI variables (parameters) available change R. typical workflow rsortie may include: Importing field plot data using R manipulate data generate SORTIE initial tree conditions (R) Defining base parameter file - selecting behaviours, tree species, diameter size classes, etc. (SORTIE GUI) Using makeFiles() update/ replace values base parameter file new values (e.g., initial tree stand conditions, number time steps, values certain behaviour parameterization experiment) Modify silvicultural treatments (e.g., harvest planting) defined base parameter file (rsortie) Run model parameter file interest, either serial parallel processing (rsortie) Extract parse model outputs (SORTIE GUI rsortie) Analyze outputs (R) Literature Cited: McIntire E, Chubaty , Cumming S, et al. PERFICT: Re-imagined Foundation Predictive Ecology. Authorea Preprints; 2021. DOI: 10.22541/au.163252535.52485317/v1

what: Modelling forest stand dynamics with SORTIE-ND in R
title: Forest stand dynamics modelling with SORTIE-ND in R
text: R package allows users interact SORTIE-ND. Specifically, users can modify input parameter files, run simulations, process output files SORTIE-ND. assume users familiar R (http://www.cran.r-project.org/), downloaded familiar SORTIE-ND (http://www.sortie-nd.org/).

title: Forest stand dynamics modelling with SORTIE-ND in R
text: 1. Install SORTIE-ND GUI. Go http://www.sortie-nd.org/software/index.html download newest version. 2. Set value JAVA-HOME environment variable (Optional) cases, SORTIE GUI know locate Java even though installed user’s system. fix issue Windows 10 computer: Search Environment Variables select Edit system Environment Variables. Click Environment Variables near bottom right. System Variables, click New. Set Variable Name JAVA_HOME. Set Variable Value C:\filepath\location\\java Click OK close Environment Variables editor. Open Command Prompt (Run administrator). Run: Verify Environment Variable added correctly restarting Command Prompt running: see file path location java.exe 3. Install rsortie github. information parameterizations SORTIE British Columbia research Bulkley Valley Research Centre, visit https://forests-bvcentre.ca. Questions regarding code directed alana.clason@bvcentre.ca sortie@bvcentre.ca
code: setx -m JAVA_HOME "C:\filepath\location\of\java" echo %JAVA_HOME% install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("aclason/rsortie", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Extract output files — extractFiles
text: extractFiles() reads directory extract files .gz.tar files present. also assumes files single .gz.tar file directory. looks first file .gz.tar, determines many subdirectories present, strips subdirectories. extracted files placed new extracted directory. want put somewhere else, change variable extractDir

title: Extract output files — extractFiles
code: extractFiles(itype, exname, onename, extime)

title: Extract output files — extractFiles
text: itype double() '1' = extract given file, otherwise extract files directory exname character() directory contains tar file(s) extracted onename character() single tar file extract (used itype = 1) extime double() Extract time?

title: Extract output files — extractFiles
text: routine returns list extracted files.

title: Extract output files — extractFiles
code: extractFiles(itype,exname,onename,extime) #> Error in extractFiles(itype, exname, onename, extime): object 'exname' not found

what: Find the location in a SORTIE base parameter file from variable name — findFileLine
title: Find the location in a SORTIE base parameter file from variable name — findFileLine
text: findFileLine() finds line within base SORTIE parameter file new values (file dataframe) identifies variable modified. file line applies base parameter file passed replaceInfo().

title: Find the location in a SORTIE base parameter file from variable name — findFileLine
code: findFileLine(rf, itype, varname, vargroup, varmaster)

title: Find the location in a SORTIE base parameter file from variable name — findFileLine
text: rf character() Base XML parameter file modified itype integer() File type varname character() variable codename vargroup character() variable group name varmaster character() variable master group

title: Find the location in a SORTIE base parameter file from variable name — findFileLine
code: samplebasexml[1:4] #> [1] "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" standalone=\"no\"?>" #> [2] "<paramFile fileCode=\"07050101\">"                            #> [3] "  <plot>"                                                     #> [4] "    <timesteps>10</timesteps>"                                VariableNames[1:4,] #>   InputFileParameterName Type        code.name group.name #> 1              Timesteps    1        timesteps            #> 2             Randomseed    1       randomSeed            #> 3       YearsPerTimestep    1 yearsPerTimestep            #> 4            rt_timestep    1      rt_timestep            gmf_time_new #>           X ACRU ACSA BEAL FAGR TSCA FRAM PIST PRSE QURU #> 1      <NA>   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA #> 2 Timesteps    7   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA   NA findFileLine(rf=samplebasexml,itype=1,varname="timesteps") #> [1] 4

what: Create new SORTIE parameter files — makeFiles
title: Create new SORTIE parameter files — makeFiles
text: makeFiles takes base SORTIE parameter file (base xmls) replaces specific values (new vals) generate new parameter files (new xmls) run SORTIE.

title: Create new SORTIE parameter files — makeFiles
code: makeFiles(   lstFiles,   path_basexmls = path_basexmls,   path_newvals = path_newvals,   path_newxmls = path_newxmls,   variable_names = rsortie::VariableNames )

title: Create new SORTIE parameter files — makeFiles
text: lstFiles name text file (string) data.frame() contains file names update updated path_basexmls (optional) file path base parameter file(s) location character() path_newvals (optional) file path new value file(s) location character() path_newxmls (optional) file path new output parameter file(s) location character() variable_names

title: Create new SORTIE parameter files — makeFiles
text: function generate new .xml files path_newxmls directory, path_newxmlsis defined, new .xml exported working directory.

title: Create new SORTIE parameter files — makeFiles
text: Common use function change number timesteps, initiate different starting stands, test effect changing values define given behaviour (process) makeFiles function requires table indicating base SORTIE parameter file (.xml) files containing values replace base parameter file. table can read file, lstFiles() string contains pathway file name list files table (.e. "pathway/listofmyfiles.csv"). list files held data.frame R environment (example), lstFiles() requires just name object. two optional pathway arguments available required files (base parameter file(s), new values file(s)) yet present R environment. makeFiles() read files translate appropriate format, requires file directory location passed path_basexml path_newvals arguments. path_newxmls provided allow users ability organize store newly generated SORTIE parameter files different directories, passed, new files placed working directory. NOTE - need assign makeFiles function named object R, output written file, returned object.

title: Create new SORTIE parameter files — makeFiles
code: exFiles <- data.frame("type"=c(0,1), "name"=c("samplebasexml","gmf_time_new")) makeFiles(lstFiles=exFiles) #> [1] "parameter file samplebas-gmf_time.xml created"

text: fname character() File path name SORTIE parameter file run sortie_loc Location SORTIE program

title: Run the SORTIE model — runSortie
text: default location sortie_loc = 0: "C:/Program Files (x86)/SORTIE/bin/coremodel.exe/", program installed else, use sortie_loc = 1 specify location coremodel.exe, end character string core model location coremodel.exe (.e add final forward slash)

title: Run the SORTIE model — runSortie
code: # MySortieLoc <- "C:/Program Files/SORTIE/bin/coremodel.exe" #(runSortie(samplebasexml,0))

code: runSortiePar(fname, numcores, sortie_loc)

title: Run SORTIE in parallel — runSortiePar
text: fname File path parameter file names run numcores many cores. Right now, number cores number files run, update allow serial runs passed across cores sortie_loc '0' defaults Program Files (x86) SORTIE location. stored elsewhere, sortie_loc = location

title: Run SORTIE in parallel — runSortiePar
code: #(runSortiePar(parameterfile.xml,numcores = 2, 0))
